Legal_Issue: Whether changed country conditions in El Salvador removed the applicant's well-founded fear of persecution
Evidence_Type: Media reports, country condition updates, threat evidence
Legal_Provision: Section 96 of the Immigration Act â€“ definition of Convention refugee
Basis_of_Claim: Fear of persecution by FMLN and military authorities due to desertion from police force
Key_Factor_in_Determination: Meaningful, effective, and durable change in country conditions
Application_Error: Board relied on insufficient evidence of positive change
Review_Outcome: Decision set aside, case remanded for redetermination
Assessment_Standard: Objective basis for fear of persecution
Evidence_Ignored: Ongoing death squad activity and threats to applicant
Legal_Standard: Change in country conditions must nullify well-founded fear
Application_Factor: Timing and reliability of post-peace accord reports
Decision_Review_Issue: Error in law regarding assessment of country conditions
Governing_Rule_or_Provision: Rule: Change in country conditions must be meaningful, effective, and durable
Outcome_of_Review: Remanded for reconsideration with updated evidence
Cause_of_Refusal: Perceived diminished risk due to peace accord
Evidentiary_Issues: Reliance on preliminary and inconclusive evidence
Procedural_Fairness: Failure to consider all relevant evidence
Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Challenge based on legal error in evaluating country conditions
Relevant_Law: Refugee Convention, Section 96 of Immigration Act
Omission_Type: Failure to account for continuing threats and violence
